page.title: 15A LOCAL PERSONALITY
page.content: Mr Arthur Ball has lived in Severn Beach all his life and is a well known resident,he leads an active life farming and may often be seen driving his old tractor on the roads _ he uses it instead of a car, unable to take his wife on it but can't afford any other form of transport he says! He works on his 100 acre farm daily _ says he won't retire. His farm has a bungalow but he prefers to live in his bungalow in Severn Beach itself. He's active in community life, a member of Parish Council and Chairman of Sandford and Gray Trust. He has appeared in local pantomimes. He is a mine of information. Severn Beach is mostly reclaimed land, tide used to come right over where Severn Beach now is until sea wall was built between 1812 and 1815, by French Prisoners from the Napoleonic Wars.
